titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Robert Amhurst Milliman papers, 1941-1950.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

archdesc.bioghist: Resident of Ypsilanti, Mich., who served in the U.S. Army during World War II.
archdesc.scopecontent: Letters to his family describing his experiences at various military bases in Texas, New York, North Carolina, and Georgia, and one letter from France; letters and documents relating to his death in Germany and burial in the Netherlands; letters from Nelly Bloem of Heerlen, Netherlands, who adopted Milliman's grave; also photographs.

c01.scopecontent: Letters to his family describing his experiences at various military bases in Texas, New York, North Carolina, and Georgia, and one letter from France; letters and documents relating to his death in Germany and burial in the Netherlands; letters from Nelly Bloem of Heerlen, Netherlands, who adopted Milliman's grave; also photographs.
Photo of Milliman in uniform; also photographs of Milliman's grave and of the Bloem family of Heerlen, Netherlands.
